item.title: Erynn add a quote by Anne McCaffrey
item.description: "A good story is a good story no matter who wrote it." -- Anne McCaffrey

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It's not worth doing something unless someone, somewhere, would much rather you weren't doing it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It is said that your life flashes before your eyes just before you die. That is true, it's called Life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'll be more enthusiastic about encouraging thinking outside the box when there's evidence of any thinking going on inside it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Time is a drug. Too much of it kills you." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "A good bookshop is just a genteel Black Hole that knows how to read." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Real stupidity beats artificial intelligence every time." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "And what would humans be without love?" RARE, said Death." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Studies have shown that an ant can carry one hundred times its own weight, but there is no known limit to the lifting power of the average tiny eighty-year-old Spanish peasant grandmother." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The three rules of the Librarians of Time and Space are: 1) Silence; 2) Books must be returned no later than the last date shown; and 3) Do not interfere with the nature of causality." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Soon to come in licorice, orange, cinnamon, and banana, but not strawberry, because I hate strawberries." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I do note with interest that old women in my books become young women on the covers... this is discrimination against the chronologically gifted." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "She'd become a governess. It was one of the few jobs a known lady could do. And she'd taken to it well. She'd sworn that if she did indeed ever find herself dancing on rooftops with chimney sweeps she'd beat herself to death with her own umbrella." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "In ancient times cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "They called themselves the Munrungs. It meant The People, or The True Human Beings. It's what most people call themselves, to begin with. And then one day the tribe meets some other People or, if it's not been a good day, The Enemy. If only they'd think up a name like Some More True Human Beings, it'd save a lot of trouble later on" -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If there was anything that depressed him more than his own cynicism, it was that quite often it still wasn't as cynical as real life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Always be wary of any helpful item that weighs less than its operating manual." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Fantasy is an exercise bicycle for the mind. It might not take you anywhere, but it tones up the muscles that can. Of course, I could be wrong." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Everything starts somewhere, though many physicists disagree. But people have always been dimly aware of the problem with the start of things. They wonder how the snowplough driver gets to work, or how the makers of dictionaries look up the spelling of words." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Elves are wonderful. They provoke wonder. Elves are marvellous. They cause marvels. Elves are fantastic. They create fantasies. Elves are glamorous. They project glamour. Elves are enchanting. They weave enchantment. Elves are terrific. They beget terror. The thing about words is that meanings can twist just like a snake, and if you want to find snakes look for them behind words that have changed their meaning. No one ever said elves are nice. Elves are bad." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Verence would rather cut his own leg off than put a witch in prison, since it'd save trouble in the long run and probably be less painful." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I DON'T HOLD WITH CRUELTY TO CATS." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Coming back to where you started is not the same as never leaving." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Joy is to fun what the deep sea is to a puddle. It’s a feeling inside that can hardly be contained." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Erynn add a quote by James Patterson
item.description: "You...are...a...fridge...with wings,' Fang ground out, punching an Eraser hard with every word. 'We're...freaking...ballet...dancers." -- James Patterson

item.title: Erynn add a quote by James Patterson
item.description: "Am I tough? Am I strong? Am I hard-core? Absolutely. Did I whimper with pathetic delight when I sank my teeth into my hot fried-chicken sandwich? You betcha." -- James Patterson
